speaker: Monica
text: What you guys don’t understand is, for us, kissing is as important as any part of it.

speaker: Joey
text: Yeah, right!……Y’serious?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Oh, yeah!

speaker: Rachel
text: Everything you need to know is in that first kiss.

speaker: Monica
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Chandler
text: Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act, y’know? I mean it’s like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd comes out.

speaker: Ross
text: Yeah, and-and it’s not that we don’t like the comedian, it’s that-that… that’s not why we bought the ticket.

speaker: Chandler
text: The problem is, though, after the concert’s over, no matter how great the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y’know? I mean, we’re in the car, we’re fighting traffic… basically just trying to stay awake.

speaker: Rachel
text: Yeah, well, word of advice: Bring back the comedian. Otherwise next time you’re gonna find yourself sitting at home, listening to that album alone.

speaker: Joey
text: …Are we still talking about sex?

description: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-worker (Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.

speaker: Ross
text: No, it’s good, it is good, it’s just that- mm- doesn’t she seem a little angry?

speaker: Marsha
text: Well, she has issues.

speaker: Ross
text: Does she.

speaker: Marsha
text: He’s out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!

speaker: Ross
text: Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like ‘Gee, that glacier’s getting kinda close.’ See?

speaker: Marsha
text: Speaking of issues, isn’t that your ex-wife?
(Carol, Ross’s ex-wife, has entered behind them and is standing outstide the exhibit.)

speaker: Ross
text: No. No.

speaker: Marsha
text: Yes, it is. Carol! Hi!

speaker: Ross
text: Okay, okay, yes, it is. (waves) How about I’ll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.
(Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.)

speaker: Ross
text: Hi.

speaker: Carol
text: So.

speaker: Ross
text: You look great. I, uh… I hate that.

speaker: Carol
text: Sorry. You look good too.

speaker: Ross
text: Ah, well, in here, anyone who… stands erect… So what’s new? Still, uh…

speaker: Carol
text: A lesbian?

speaker: Ross
text: Well… you never know. How’s, um.. how’s the family?

speaker: Carol
text: Marty’s still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-

speaker: Ross
text: Why- why are you here, Carol?

speaker: Carol
text: I’m pregnant.

speaker: Ross
text: Pregnant?!

description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are watching Three’s Company.

speaker: Chandler
text: Oh, I think this is the episode of Three’s Company where there’s some kind of misunderstanding.

speaker: Phoebe
text: …Then I’ve already seen this one! (Turns off the TV.)

speaker: Monica
text: Are you through with that?

speaker: Joey
text: Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down.

speaker: Monica
text: Whose little ball of paper is this?!

speaker: Chandler
text: Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn’t need it, so I balled it up and… (sees that Monica is glaring at him) …now I wish I was dead.
(Monica starts to fluff a pillow.)

speaker: Phoebe
text: She’s already fluffed that pillow… Monica, you know, you’ve already fluffed that- (Monica glares at her.) -but, it’s fine!

speaker: Monica
text: Look , I’m sorry, guys, I just don’t wanna give them any more ammunition than they already have.

speaker: Chandler
text: Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a child’s pillow.

speaker: Phoebe
text: Monica- Hi! Um, Monica, you’re scaring me. I mean, you’re like, you’re like all chaotic and twirly. And not-not in a good way.

speaker: Joey
text: Yeah, calm down. You don’t see Ross getting all chaotic and twirly every time they come.

speaker: Monica
text: That’s because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong. Y’see, he’s the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.

speaker: Chandler
text: Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!

speaker: Monica
text: What?

speaker: Chandler
text: Ugly Naked Guy got a Thighmaster!

speaker: All
text: Eeaagh!
(Rachel enters from her room.)

speaker: Rachel
text: Has anybody seen my engagement ring?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Yeah, it’s beautiful.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh God, oh God, oh God oh God oh God oh God… (Starts to look under the couch cushions.)

speaker: Phoebe
text: No, look, don’t touch that!

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, like I wasn’t dreading tomorrow enough, having to give it back to him… “Hi Barry! Remember me? I’m the girl in the veil who stomped on your heart in front of your entire family!” Oh God and now I’m gonna have to return the ring, without the ring, which makes it so much harder…

speaker: Monica
text: Easy Rach, we’ll find it. (To all) Won’t we!

speaker: Chandler and Joey
text: Oh! Yeah!

speaker: Joey
text: Alright, when’d’ya have it on last?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Doy! Probably right before she lost it!

speaker: Chandler
text: You don’t get a lot of ’doy’ these days…

speaker: Rachel
text: I know I had it this morning, and I know I had it when I was in the kitchen with…

speaker: Chandler
text: …Dinah?

speaker: Rachel
text: Ohhhhh, don’t be mad…
parenthetical: looks at the lasagne and realizes something

speaker: Monica
text: You didn’t.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, I am sorry…

speaker: Monica
text: I gave you one job! (Starts to examin the lasagne through the bottom of the glass pan.)

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, but look how straight those noodles are!

speaker: Chandler
text: Now, Monica, you know that’s not how you look for an engagement ring in a lasagne…

speaker: Monica
text: I just… can’t do it.

speaker: Chandler
text: Boys? We’re going in.
(Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe start to pick through the lasagne as there’s a knock on the door which Monica answers.)

speaker: Ross
text: …Hi.

speaker: Monica
text: Wow. That is not a happy hi.

speaker: Ross
text: Carol’s pregnant.

speaker: Phoebe
text: Ooh! I found it!

speaker: Monica
text: W-w-wh-… wha-… w-w-w-…

speaker: Ross
text: Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about now. (He enters.)

speaker: Chandler
text: Kinda puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon?

speaker: Rachel
text: Well now, how-how do you fit into this whole thing?

speaker: Ross
text: Well, Carol says she and Susan want me to be involved, but if I’m not comfortable with it, I don’t have to be involved.. basically it’s entirely up to me.

speaker: Phoebe
text: She is so great! I miss her.

speaker: Monica
text: What does she mean by ‘involved’?

speaker: Chandler
text: I mean presumably, the biggest part of your job is done.

speaker: Ross
text: Anyway, they want me to go down to this- sonogram thing with them tomorrow.

speaker: Rachel
text: So what are you gonna do?

speaker: Ross
text: I have no idea. No matter what I do, though, I’m still gonna be a father.
(Joey starts to eat the rest of the lasagne and everyone turns and stares at him.)

speaker: Joey
text: …Well, this is still ruined, right?

description: [Scene, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Ross are pouring wine for their parents.]

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Oh, Martha Ludwin’s daughter is gonna call you. (Tastes a snack) Mmm! What’s that curry taste?

speaker: Monica
text: Curry.

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Mmmm!

speaker: Ross
text: I- I think they’re great! I, I really do.

speaker: Mr. Geller
text: Do you remember the Ludwins? The big one had a thing for you, didn’t she?

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: They all had a thing for him.

speaker: Ross
text: Aw, Mom…

speaker: Monica
text: I’m sorry, why is this girl going to call me?

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Oh, she just graduated, and she wants to be something in cooking, or food, or… I don’t know. Anyway, I told her you had a restaurant-

speaker: Monica
text: No Mom, I don’t have a restaurant, I work in a restaurant.

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Well, they don’t have to know that… (She starts to fluff the same pillow Monica fluffed multiple times earlier.)

speaker: Monica
text: Ross, could you come and help me with the spaghetti, please?

speaker: Ross
text: Yeah. (They go to the kitchen.)

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Oh, we’re having spaghetti! That’s… easy.

speaker: Monica
text: I know this is going to sound unbelievably selfish, but, were you planning on bringing up the whole baby/lesbian thing? Because I think it might take some of the heat off me.
[Time Lapse, everyone is now eating.]

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: What that Rachel did to her life… We ran into her parents at the club, they were not playing very well.

speaker: Mr. Geller
text: I’m not gonna tell you what they spent on that wedding… but forty thousand dollars is a lot of money!

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Well, at least she had the chance to leave a man at the altar…

speaker: Monica
text: What’s that supposed to mean?

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: Nothing! It’s an expression.

speaker: Monica
text: No it’s not.

speaker: Mr. Geller
text: Don’t listen to your mother. You’re independent, and you always have been! Even when you were a kid… and you were chubby, and you had no friends, you were just fine! And you would read alone in your room, and your puzzles…
[Time Lapse.]

speaker: Mr. Geller
text: Look, there are people like Ross who need to shoot for the stars, with his museum, and his papers getting published. Other people are satisfied with staying where they are- I’m telling you, these are the people who never get cancer.
[Time Lapse.]

speaker: Mr. Geller
text: …And I read about these women trying to have it all, and I thank God ‘Our Little Harmonica’ doesn’t seem to have that problem.

speaker: Monica
text: So, Ross, what’s going on with you? Any stories? (Digs her elbow into his hand.) No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks?
parenthetical: trying desperately to change the subject

speaker: Ross
text: Okay! Okay. (To his parents) Look, I, uh- I realise you guys have been wondering what exactly happened between Carol and me, and, so, well, here’s the deal. Carol’s a lesbian. She’s living with a woman named Susan. She’s pregnant with my child, and she and Susan are going to raise the baby.
(Stunned silence ensues.)

speaker: Mrs. Geller
text: And you knew about this?!

speaker: Joey
text: Your folks are really that bad, huh?

speaker: Ross
text: Well, y’know, these people are pros. They know what they’re doing, they take their time, they get the job done.

speaker: Monica
text: Boy, I know they say you can’t change your parents,… boy, if you could- (To Ross) -I’d want yours.

speaker: Ross
text: Must pee. (Goes to pee.)

speaker: Phoebe
text: Y’know, it’s even worse when you’re twins.

speaker: Rachel
text: You’re twins?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Yeah. We don’t speak. She’s like this high-powered, driven career type.

speaker: Chandler
text: What does she do?

speaker: Phoebe
text: She’s a waitress.

speaker: Rachel
text: All right, you guys, I kinda gotta clean up now. (They all start to leave.)

speaker: Monica
text: Chandler, you’re an only child, right? You don’t have any of this.

speaker: Chandler
text: Well, no, although I did have an imaginary friend, who… my parents actually preferred.

speaker: Rachel
text: The lights, please..
(Joey turns off the lights, and they all leave as Rachel starts to clean up. Ross enters from the bathroom.)

speaker: Ross
text: …How long was I in there?

speaker: Rachel
text: I’m just cleaning up.

speaker: Ross
text: D’ya.. uh.. d’ya need any help?

speaker: Rachel
text: Uh.. okay, sure! Thanks! (She hands him the broom and sits down.)

speaker: Ross
text: Anyway.. um.. (Starts to sweep.) So, you- uh- you nervous about Barry tomorrow?

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh.. a little..

speaker: Ross
text: Mm-hmm..

speaker: Rachel
text: A lot.

speaker: Ross
text: Mm.

speaker: Rachel
text: So, got any advice? Y’know, as someone who’s recently been- dumped?

speaker: Ross
text: Well, you may wanna steer clear of the word ‘dumped’. Chances are he’s gonna be this, this broken shell of a man, y’know, so you should try not to look too terrific, I know it’ll be hard. Or, y’know, uh, hey!, I’ll go down there, and I’ll give Barry back his ring, and you can go with Carol and Susan to the OB/GYN…

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, you’ve got Carol tomorrow.. When did it get so complicated?

speaker: Ross
text: Got me.

speaker: Rachel
text: Remember when we were in high school together?

speaker: Ross
text: Yeah.

speaker: Rachel
text: I mean, didn’t you think you were just gonna meet somone, fall in love- and that’d be it? (Ross gazes at her.) ..Ross?

speaker: Ross
text: Yes, yes!

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh! Man, I never thought I’d be here.. (She leans back onto his hand.)

speaker: Ross
text: Me either… (He pulls up a stool so that he doesn’t have to move his hand.)

speaker: Ross
text: Sorry I’m late, I was stuck at work. There was this big dinosaur.. thing.. anyway.
(Susan enters holding a drink.)

speaker: Susan
text: Hi.

speaker: Carol
text: Ross, you remember Susan.

speaker: Ross
text: How could I forget?

speaker: Susan
text: Ross.

speaker: Ross
text: Hello, Susan. (To Carol) Good shake. Good shake. So, uh, we’re just waiting for…?

speaker: Carol
text: Dr. Oberman.

speaker: Ross
text: ..Dr. Oberman. Okay. And is he-

speaker: Susan
text: She.

speaker: Ross
text: -she, of course, she- uh- familiar with our.. special situation?

speaker: Carol
text: Yes, and she’s very supportive.

speaker: Ross
text: Okay, that’s great. (Susan gives her drink to Carol.) No, I’m- Oh.

speaker: Carol
text: Thanks.

speaker: Ross
text: Quack, quack..
parenthetical: picks up a surgical instrament and mimes a duck with it

speaker: Carol
text: Ross? That opens my cervix. (He drops it in horror.)

description: [Scene Barry’s office, Barry is working on patient, Robbie, as Rachel enters.]

speaker: Rachel
text: Barry?

speaker: Barry
text: C’mon in.

speaker: Rachel
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Barry
text: Yeah! It’s fine, it’s fine. Robbie’s gonna be here for hours.

speaker: Robbie
text: Huh?!

speaker: Barry
text: So, how ya doin?

speaker: Rachel
text: I’m- uh- I’m okay… You look great!

speaker: Barry
text: Yeah, well..

speaker: Bernice
text: Dr. Farber, Jason Greenstein’s gagging.

speaker: Barry
text: Be right there. (To Robbie and Rachel) Be back in a sec.
(As Barry exits Robbie stares at Rachel.)

speaker: Rachel
text: I dumped him.

speaker: Robbie
text: Okay.

description: Carol’s OB/GYN, they’re talking about how this is going to work.

speaker: Ross
text: So, um- so how’s this, uh, how’s this gonna work? Y’know, with us? Y’know, when, like, important decisions have to be made?

speaker: Carol
text: Give me a ‘for instance’.

speaker: Ross
text: Well, uh, uh, I don’t know, okay, okay, how about with the, uh, with the baby’s name?

speaker: Carol
text: Marlon-

speaker: Ross
text: Marlon?!

speaker: Carol
text: -if it’s a boy, Minnie if it’s a girl.

speaker: Ross
text: …As in Mouse?

speaker: Carol
text: As in my grandmother.

speaker: Ross
text: Still, you- you say Minnie, you hear Mouse. Um, how about, um.. how about Julia?

speaker: Carol
text: Julia..

speaker: Susan
text: We agreed on Minnie.

speaker: Ross
text: ’s’funny, um, uh, we agreed we’d spend the rest of our lives together. Things change, roll with the punches. I believe Julia’s on the table…?

description: Barry’s office, Rachel is doing her makeup in the mirror on Barry’s lamp as Barry enters.

speaker: Barry
text: Sorry about that. So. What have you been up to?

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, not much. I-I got a job.

speaker: Barry
text: Oh, that’s great.

speaker: Rachel
text: Why are- why are you so tanned?

speaker: Barry
text: Oh, I, uh- I went to Aruba.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh no. You went on our honeymoon alone?

speaker: Barry
text: No. I went with, uh.. Now, this may hurt.

speaker: Robbie
text: Me?!

speaker: Barry
text: No! (To Rachel) I went with Mindy.

speaker: Rachel
text: Mindy?! My maid of honour, Mindy?!

speaker: Barry
text: Yeah, well, uh, we’re kind of a thing now.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh! Well, um.. (Grabs his forehand) You’ve got plugs!

speaker: Barry
text: Careful! They haven’t quite taken yet.

speaker: Rachel
text: And you’ve got lenses! But you hate sticking your finger in your eye!

speaker: Barry
text: Not for her. Listen, I really wanted to thank you.

speaker: Rachel
text: Okay..

speaker: Barry
text: See, about a month ago, I wanted to hurt you. More than I’ve ever wanted to hurt anyone in my life. And I’m an orthodontist.

speaker: Rachel
text: Wow.

speaker: Barry
text: You know, you were right? I mean, I thought we were happy. We weren’t happy. But with Mindy, now I’m happy. Spit.

speaker: Rachel
text: What?

speaker: Robbie
text: Me. (Spits.)

speaker: Rachel
text: Anyway, um, (Gets the ring out of her purse.) I guess this belongs to you. And thank you for giving it to me.

speaker: Barry
text: Well, thank you for giving it back.
(Barry and Rachel look at each other.)

speaker: Robbie
text: Hello?!

description: Carol’s OB/GYN, they’re still arguing about what to name the baby.

speaker: Susan
text: Oh, please! What’s wrong with Helen?

speaker: Ross
text: Helen Geller? I don’t think so.

speaker: Carol
text: Hello? It’s not gonna be Helen Geller.

speaker: Ross
text: Thank you!

speaker: Carol
text: No, I mean it’s not Geller.

speaker: Ross
text: What, it’s gonna be Helen Willick?

speaker: Carol
text: No, actually, um, we talked about Helen Willick-Bunch.

speaker: Ross
text: Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?

speaker: Susan
text: It’s my baby too.

speaker: Ross
text: Oh, ’s’funny, really? Um, I don’t remember you making any sperm.

speaker: Susan
text: Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!

speaker: Carol
text: All right, you two, stop it!

speaker: Ross
text: No no no, she gets a credit, hey, I’m in there too.

speaker: Carol
text: Ross. You’re not actually suggesting Helen Willick-Bunch-Geller? ’Cause I think that borders on child abuse.

speaker: Ross
text: Of course not, I’m… suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.

speaker: Susan
text: Oh, no, nonononono, you see what he’s doing? He knows no-one’s gonna say all those names, so they’ll wind up calling her Geller, then he gets his way!

speaker: Ross
text: My way?! You-you think this is my way? Believe me, of all the ways I ever imagined this moment in my life being, this is not my way- y’know what? Uh, um, this is too hard. I’m not, I can’t do-

speaker: Dr. Oberman
text: Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?

speaker: All
text: Yeah. Yeah. A little.

speaker: Dr. Oberman
text: Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks for sharing. (To Carol) Uh, lie back..

speaker: Ross
text: You- uh- y’know what, I’m gonna go. I don’t- I don’t think I can be involved in this particular thing right now.
(He turns to go, but the sound of the sonogram catches hes ear. He returns and stares at it.)

speaker: Ross
text: Oh my God.

speaker: Susan
text: Look at that.

speaker: Carol
text: I know.

description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment, everyone is watching the tape of the sonogram. Rachel is on the phone.

speaker: Ross
text: Well? Isn’t that amazing?

speaker: Joey
text: What are we supposed to be seeing here?

speaker: Chandler
text: I dunno, but.. I think it’s about to attack the Enterprise.

speaker: Phoebe
text: You know, if you tilt your head to the left, and relax your eyes, it kinda looks like an old potato.

speaker: Ross
text: Then don’t do that, alright?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Okay!

speaker: Ross
text: Monica. Whaddya think?
parenthetical: walks over to where Monica is standing

speaker: Monica
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Ross
text: Wh- are you welling up?

speaker: Monica
text: No.

speaker: Ross
text: You are, you’re welling up.

speaker: Monica
text: Am not!

speaker: Ross
text: You’re gonna be an aunt.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh shut up!
parenthetical: pushes him and starts to cry

speaker: Rachel
text: Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it’s Rachel. Yeah, I’m fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it’s okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y’know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. (Slams the phone down.) (To everyone) Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.
